intro: Salsola henriciae, commonly known as desert goosefoot, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in desert environments. The plant has small, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water, and its flowers are usually greenish-yellow, appearing in clusters. It produces small, round fruits that are adapted for dispersal by animals and wind. Salsola henriciae is well adapted to harsh conditions and plays a role in stabilizing desert soils.
